alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 10:51AM CDT until April 23 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring with moderate flooding forecasted to start tonight. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 49.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Thursday was 49.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 53.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 52.1 feet on 04/07/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM CDT.
